text: my nickname for this dish is pizza
chicken because it's the toppings of the
pizza on top of a pan full of chicken
and that's just delicious
this dish is all about building flavor
in the pan when I first made this dish I
didn't use the pancetta but it just
desperately wanted to be there so now I
add it right at the beginning and then
it flavors the fat in the pan which I
then use to brown the chicken you want
to use bone-in chicken here because it
won't dry out but if you like all dark
meat you can use that if you like all
white meat you can use all breasts
that's up to you
every time I add something to this pan
the flavor just keeps building so now
I'm gonna do garlic anchovy red pepper
I had anchovies - the tomato sauce you
can't really taste them but they add so
much complexity and flavor that it just
makes everything taste better the best
thing to use for this is a 12-inch
skillet everybody should have a 12-inch
skillet because it gives ingredients
room to breathe and you can use it for
so many things if you don't have one go
get one once the sauce gets a little bit
thick then you can just add the chicken
right back to the pan and I'm just gonna
put it in the oven
so that it can finish cooking instead of
using grated mozzarella for this dish I
use bocconcini which are these little
balls of mozzarella cheese that I have
and then I scatter them in the pan and
when they melt they leave these little
gooey gooey pockets they're so delicious
next to the sauce I throw this under the
broiler right at the end so that the
cheese gets all melty and then the edges
get all crispy melty crispy it's just
hitting all the right notes in case you
thought I forgot about that pancetta
goes right on top as a garnish along
with some fresh basil
even though I call this pizza chicken do
not use this to serve it a spoon works
best
Oh
